Rice straw cellulose was activated by hydrolysis under strongly acidic conditions to increase the active group content, surface area, and catalytic efficiency. This hydrolysis resulted in the cleavage of glycoside bonds to form nanocellulose sulfonates, which, in turn, were hybridized with α-Fe2O3–ZrO2 to form cellulose@α-Fe2O3–ZrO2 nanocomposites (Figure 1).Figure 1
Proposed scheme of cellulose@α-Fe2O3–ZrO2 nanocomposites formation.Figure 1
